Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bronzino from restaurant week: why would someone sit crispy skinned bronzino in a broth is beyond me...

uiykGcyZJgyHVkix5W0oIg.text: Finally checked this place out yesterday with friends. The entrance is confusing. I don't know why they would prefer to use a small side door rather than the main entrance. I walked around the building through I missed the entrance and walked around it again, I decide to try the small door after I found out there is really no other doors. It was the bar entrance. It was not busy for a Monday night. The food was good, properly cooked as the menu described; service was ok, but very slow(they weren't busy at all). water refill was super slow, get it after we were out of water for a while. Had to ask for drink refill too. Over all it was a good experience but there are definitely some improvement can be made for their service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Otnwp_vGrQt5rFsPUt3bkg.text: Had a very nice dinner. Doug gave us nice service and a good wine recommendation. If you like to have good food and drink wine this is the place. Wines are very reasonable unlike most restaurants. Food is very good. Crab cake appetizer could be a main course. Lots of seafood courses and the beef filet was excellent. Recommended.

MTd_hV_1Njmp5M9_grTZDw.text: My husband and I ordered main dishes of crab cakes, shrimp, scallops, and steak. They tasted fine but never made me think "mmm". We also ordered bread, and we had to ask for it a second time. The bread finally came out after 35 minutes. The waiter also forgot to bring our side dish of asparagus, so we had to ask for it again. The waiter mostly looked at and spoke to my husband, although the reservation was in my name. We repeatedly overheard the manager yell at the hostess from across the restaurant. Because it was my birthday, the restaurant gave me a free chocolate chip cookie with ice cream, and it tasted very good.

MMg8UdqTxGubqvsbPCE8BA.text: We came  for lunch.  A friend ordered the Lamb sliders. she thought they were undercooked and asked the waiter to take them back.  After waiting another 15 min the sliders were returned with the bread burned and the lamb was still undercooked! She mentioned to the waiter that it looked like the whole slider bun and all had been thrown in the broiler he replied with a curt 'no'.  A manager then came over and offered her another entree but by this time we had already waited more than 50 minutes for our orders.  They did not charge her for the meal...but they were also not very apologetic about the bad service and food.   We will not be returning. This is not the first time in the past few years that the food has not been up to par.  The menu has changed and not for the better. The Carlton was our go to place for a good lunch but after today's experience.......not anymore.

XjfdGEBFqS0WP4ATLzTMSg.text: Maybe it is my age group but I honestly have never been to The Carlton and thought of it as a place for the much older crowd.  I was headed to a show and someone made a reservation and  The Carlton did not disappoint at all.   I love my dinner so much it was gone before I remember to take a picture.  I ordered the short ribs with whipped potatoes and broccoli.  It was an amazing comfort food dish that took me back to my mothers cooking.  On a cold winters evening it was the perfect dish.  To end the evening I had the creme brulee and well. How can that not be amazing.   I will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

KTQum6KaKxqbzhWg1-OhZw.text: There are so many mixed reviews here! I'll take it to mean that the variance is pretty high and that we got lucky. We stopped in for the Restaurant Week lunch, which was generously priced for a restaurant of this caliber (similar to The Capital Grille). We made a reservation, although it seemed like it was unnecessary. Service was pretty standard from checking in all through our meal. We started with a crab bisque for the first course, which was very tasty and contained surprisingly many pieces of seafood. It went well with the bread as well.  The main course was an amazingly tender and flavorful piece of prime rib cap, along with some asparagus, tomato, and buttered rice. The prime rib was unbelievably tender---it came apart easily and also had great texture. And it was done perfectly (I got medium rare). The sides were fine, though the rice was probably a bit too rich. The desserts were standard options of a bread pudding or a chocolate espresso cake, both of which were quite good.   Great move by The Carlton to offer this option for Restaurant Week!

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate espresso cake
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prime rib cap

l63oF-XASBzlkhTe8pLXjQ.text: Enzo our server was amazing! He went above and beyond to make sure we had a perfect night! Ate here before the Phantom Of the Opera and I can't say enough good things about Enzo and the Fantastic meal we had . We had the filet and scallops and they were made to perfection! Enzo was very knowledgeable about everything on the menu and made some great recommendations. Took a lemo to the show! They entire night was perfect and started here! Thank you Enzo and the Carlton for an amazing night!

uK7G354cIRSbNNau4dflbA.text: This place is pretty big, but I've seen it get quite crowded so I would recommend reservations. I've been here many times over the past few years and have been impressed with each meal and each overall experience. Their menu changes often, but they have a few standard menu items that have stuck.   A few of my favorite apps include the Calamari (not usually a fan but they prepare it VERY well so it is not super chewy) and the Lobster & Crab Gnocchi. As far as the entrees, you can't go wrong with a steak here. I've done this multiple times...I typically go with the filet- medium rare, and it's always cooked to perfection. Other favorites of mine include the Duck Pasta or Scallops.   When I was here recently, our server was Russell and he was absolutely wonderful. Friendly, funny, attentive and truly enhanced our meal overall. He made some great wine recommendations as well!  If you are planning a night out downtown or just want to treat yourself, I highly recommend The Carlton!

FemJI-906SXgik6s51Vzpw.text: We had a good meal but a disappointing experience at dinner last night before the Pens game. The food, as always, was very good, but the service was very poor. The place was overbooked with big holiday party tables and Pens fans. Our server was overwhelmed. I begged several times for a wine list but never actually got one. Remember, this is supposed to be a wine-focused restaurant. It was a disappointing but understandable circumstance. We'll go back, even for Pens pregame dinners, because the parking situation is about as good as it gets - free (with the purchase of a dinner, that is) and close.

_5eDJkUCQftMMc1-xdDtzw.text: So, it's been a while since we visited this old gem because there's always something fresh and new to try. Shame on us, honestly. Pretty much everything was great, from the greeting, to the seating, to the service, to the timeliness of our apps and entrees (we were going to a concert and needed to not linger). Kudos to the kitchen, the Branzino special was cooked perfectly, nice crispy skin, tender delicious fish, all the garnish was delicious. His veal chop was  gorgeous, well-prepared, and very tasty. No time for dessert, but coffee was dynamite, as good as the coffee at the Duquesne Club, and that's not easy to do. The busboy was kind enough to check with the kitchen to see what herbs were in the delicious butter that came with the bread plate. I am not a huge fan of the dark wood decor and I think it could use an update, but with quality food and a great staff this is a solid 4.5 star restaurant! The Carlton has been a class act in Pittsburgh for a LONG time, many other places have come and gone and it is still drawing crowds. Kudos!

r-xnZEhrN7s2kePHy1aoRQ.text: I absolutely loved this place when I went for the first time. We also were going to see a performance,and was able to take advantage of the limo services they provide. It really added to the elegant ambience of the entire night. This place is such as old time gem ,and I have no complaints at all. Absolutely love this place.

WLiHSYeWU0Llf6kcvpbMgw.text: Unlike some of the reviewers that debated going to the Carlton due to mixed reviews, we had been there a few times before and had very good experiences. The other couple in our party however had not been there before so we were excited to see how they enjoyed the restaurant. The other members in our party arrived earlier than our reservation time and were seated promptly. They had a glass of wine and asked for a menu to order an appetizer while waiting for us. The server left the menu and when we arrived at the reservation time,15 minutes later, the server had not returned to take their appetizer order. We were approached about drinks and I ordered wine and my husband ordered a soda. Of course I received the wine but  he never brought the soda so we had to ask again.   We were rushed into placing our dinner order and I can never remember in my life, especially in a restaurant of this caliber, not being asked about appetizer, soup salad etc to go with meal. He basically asked about our entree and went on his way. I'm sure we could have pushed the point but I think we were all looking at each other like " what just happened?" Other tables had baskets of bread which we did not receive. When the entrees arrived, only three came out and at this point my brother in law left the table and went to see the manager. What upscale restaurant would allow that?  So we all stared at our food getting cold while waiting for the final entree to arrive. The manager apologized, offering free dessert which at this point none of us were interested in. We just wanted to finish our food and leave.  Our issues were definitely service related. Food was average. Filet cooked as requested. Branzino was good. The risotto on which is sat was like paste. I did not eat that nor the tasteless side veggies. Sea bass was good, 4 green beans on the side. Really? Prime rib looked ok. Cooked appropriately.  Price of entrees was reasonable. We ended up getting out of there and went to another restaurant for drinks and appetizers as the men in our party were still hungry when we left.  Sad part is this used to be a favorite restaurant of ours, we liked  the old school feel of the restaurant. Our Initial plan was to go to Hyde Park but due to steeler game no valet available there and didn't want the parking hassle so we opted for the Carlton. Will not come back and will go to Eddie Merlot,  Hyde Park or Ruths Chris in the future where service is exemplary.

tZXp3DNlhlnBpymJZA7hMw.text: Honestly the best food I have ever had! I enjoyed the halibut, beef tenderloin, and lobster and shrimp gnocchi. All amazing dishes!

lJti9iwLkwpKkeh9b2JFzQ.text: To me the Carlton can seem like a place that is past it's prime. It's not "new," trendy or avant-garde. That said a recent lunch experience really proved me wrong.   The service is a total stand out. Our waiter was very skilled in making recommendations, handling the table, and keeping our lunch moving along perfectly, as it was a business affair. He handled everything from prompting orders to delivering the check and taking payment with perfect tact.   I was also so pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food. The bread and seasoned butter was FANTASTIC. I had some type of cheesy sourdough. If it wasn't a business meeting I probably would have had three slices.   I had the southwest salad. Wow! It was a huge portion and everything was so fresh. The dressing was really tasty and the lettuce was perfectly cut so I didn't have a hard time eating it politely. Everyone in our party had a different salad and they all looked delicious.It was also very reasonable for a place I would typically think of as extravagant! Our bill came to just over $100 for 5 people before tip.  Before this meal, I never would have thought of coming to the Carlton for something other than business. Now, I would welcome the opportunity.

Xz8nw8JMjwIIDGDuGFV8og.text: I LOVE this place!  It's very "old school" in the decor and atmosphere, which takes me back to the days when elegant restaurants just had that certain look and appeal.  The wait staff is very attentive but not over-bearing.  As far as the food goes, their choices are somewhat limited, but the food is always fresh and the playing is excellent.   I like the meat dishes more than the seafood although I've tried both and neither is a disappointment.  Portions are fair so you don't leave hungry, but there is still room for dessert. I recommend the classic cheese cake with a nice cup of coffee after dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My daughters all dressed up for a night on the town and a wonderful dinner :-)
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nice evening out and fabulous dinner at The Carlton restaurant!

uMrpABux0o7o8X6DTzpSCw.text: Subpar food, drinks, and service. Stopped in for a celebration dinner based on the good reviews, but everything was fairly disappointing. Cocktail tasted like something I mixed myself in college, mashed potatoes over salted, steak was meh. Everything was just meh. Server kept forgetting our menus and clearly wasn't too experienced. Maybe we're a little snobby because we're used to Philadelphia dining? We're not quite familiar with Pittsburgh dining. Just would not recommend this place though.

YMhYLITlvscoQi7lSxbrmg.text: Went for lunch and the food was good, service was slow. If you are seeking a white table cloth restaurant I would rather visit Capital Grill

9ZKYBwCXxNSTmJws_55J3Q.text: My boyfriend found The Carlton from searching online for restaurants to go to for an early Valentine's Day dinner on Friday night. I had no idea where we were going and was a little thrown off when we walked into the BNY Mellon Center. As soon as we walked into The Carlton I had a feeling I would like it due to the amount of wine they had lining the walls! The atmosphere was dark and cozy, and it was an older crowd inside. I think I might have been the youngest person in there! We had 7:30 reservations and it was busy until we left around 10.   To start, we ordered a bottle of Pinot Noir. They had just about any price range of wine from $16-$160. Chris and I aren't huge wine connoisseurs so we went with a mid price range bottle. We also got the shishito peppers for an appetizer. These were served with a corn and sausage dipping sauce. It was pretty good but I wish it was a little spicier. After chatting, eating, and finishing bottle of wine #1 we ordered a second bottle and our entrees. I was feeling adventurous and ordered the Barramundi entree. I've never even heard of this fish but she said it was a white fish similar to Sea bass. It was served with shrimp too! The side was a tomato and basil Risotto and some kind of leafy vegetable (can't remember).  The fish was seasoned with Cajun flavors and was super flavorful, I also loved the risotto! Chris ordered the pork chop that was was served with a sausage hash and had a BBQ glaze on top. We both agreed it was kind of a random concoction but it worked.   Our waitress was also very nice and the perfect amount of attentive. She knew we were looking for a nice night out to enjoy each others company so she never tried to rush us which I am always appreciative of. The Carlton is a nice old school restaurant, as Chris said he wasn't in the mood for anything "hipster & trendy" so he hit the nail on the head with The Carlton!

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Barramundi &amp; shrimp entree
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shishito Pepper App
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yummy Pinot Noir!

QM1VnKcFSjwSofGQjNHrag.text: Surf and turf with a fillet and lobster wellington was excellent. Everyone was nice and helpful. The went the extra mile to make our experience great.

nnohzEZDhB2RV84mKv3qeA.text: Good food with great service.  There were so many choices that looked great. They change their menu consistently so you won't get bored. Wine selection was great as well. Good meal for a reasonable price downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mero with fruit salsa
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mahi mahi in coconut curry

ZQ0PZl5aGAYypw3VG55wbg.text: I have been here a few times now for lunch and dinner.  I wold not say it is bad food by any means.  However, the setup, decor, and prices of the place all would indicate the place is on the level with places like Capital Grille, McCormick & Schmick's, etc., however the food quality is just not there.  I have had several different things here.  Twice I have had the burger.  Once I had crab cakes and another time I had sued & turf.  The crab cakes were the best out of the things I have had, and paired really well with the dijon cream sauce that came with it.  Overall though it was nothing special and did not contain nearly enough crab meat.  The surf and turf was tiny and over cooked.  The burger, which I had heard great things about, tasted more like meatloaf than a burger.  On top of that, both times I have ordered the burger it has been closer to well done than my requested medium rare.  The flavor of the beef and toppings were still enough to make for a good burger, but like I said you expect more from a place that presents itself the way the Carlton does.

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Carlton Burger...way overcooked

4Mv0GYAKhD0WeYljIzryiw.text: Went for dinner last night.  Very slow service. Waiter was absent, courses came out extraordinarily slow.  Waited a half hour to get the bill.    Food was mediocre at best.  I got the waygu beef strip steak.  It was poor. A steak from long horn would have even been much better.    Everyone had similar feelings about their meals.   Mediocre   For the price point this place is an absolute joke.

RWw7vVcKJerKco0xVamsIQ.text: Excellent service & scrumptious food. They even prepared a surprise for my birthday!! I like the different textures of flavors from the Mahi mahi melting in my mouth. You won't be disappointed by their different seafood and wine options.

Wkp25VPpEOowmv5-J_qVfw.text: The Carlton is one of my favorite restaurants & I've never had a bad meal! Their quality & consistency are both top notch, paired with a knowledgeable wait staff to make suggestions and answer questions always make for a great experience. The pricing on alcohol is extremely fair compared to other restaurants in the city. Extensive wine cellar, always have something I liked. Their menu has a great variety & my husband and I try to work through it but we have our favorites! Chris was our server and he was most attentive & friendly.

TuJb350JnuLxGRwL8MiVwQ.text: Came to The Carlton for Pittsburgh Winter Restaurant Week, and was not disappointed with the experience.  From the moment we walked into the establishment there was a sense of welcoming and warm. The hostess made sure the seating, parking, and coat check were taken care of. The waitress also did a great job throughout the night. She even brought a little candle to the table upon request.   The meal courses/ wine pairings were equally as good. The flavor profiles of all the food all worked well together. I highly recommend the Braised Beef Tips. Great menu for restaurant week.

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Banana Cream Pie
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kung Pao Chicken
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Braised Beef Tips

kXtWlcPDWW9aicG6tHLBCQ.text: Always always a good meal at this Pittsburgh Staple.  Old school dinner club dining experience.  Great place to go before a show too.   You get free parking and a limo ride.

IFBCAeP59ABXMpsRJk5cNw.text: While this isn't my favorite place ever per se, I think the Carlton definitely fulfills a niche in Pittsburgh. If you're looking for a fancier white table cloth dinner in downtown Pittsburgh, this is your place.   One of the great perks offered is a limo service to any of the local shows and free parking so its very convenient. The wine list is probably the most extensive I've seen and the wine is fairly priced.  However, the reason it isn't my favorite is I think the food is safe. While safe means is good and means it is consistently that way, there was nothing that wowed me. Additionally a big area of improvement, and maybe this is because I'm a gen Z'er, would be adding music to the restaurant. I think the atmosphere would be drastically improved just with some tunes.   Definitely a quality place overall though and you can't beat the free parking and limo service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crab and Lobster Gnocci
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

dmL9Di0R1FjE9t4a1tGmNA.text: Old school white tablecloth steak and seafood restaurant downtown.  The menus change often but are similar.  For dinner I've had the tomato and mozzarella salad which is delish. Mozzarella balls, fresh basil, oils, etc.  When I come to a place like this I want the good stuff...and I've had it in the form of chicken Parmesan and strip (New York). Quality entrees that always allows me to take some home in a doggy bag.  Me and the boyfriend like to split meals but we don't here. It would be weird and he likes the Surf & Turf.

sQuDxC9wc_IEBPM2ODvGdA.text: Hands down the rest dining experience we had in Pittsburgh! Great wine list great value on food and wine service was great . The only reason I would consider coming back ! If it wasn't for this experience I was leaving town early !!! Thankyou

av9McG-QW_HX2ZcUa4ANKg.text: Easy choice for lunch for me and my girlfriends. Close to work excellent service, good variety in the menu

feS13Zw_d0h27kZz3brLFQ.text: We loved The Carlton! The food was delicious -- from the Lobster & Crab Gnocchi appetizer to our entrees, the Chilean Sea Bass and the Cajun Baramundi with Tomato-Basil Risotto! Our server, Bobby, told us he's worked at The Carlton for 20 years! and it was obvious by his friendly, comfortable manner, his excellent menu recommendations, and his prompt, non-obtrusive service! The restaurant is relaxing and beautiful, with a 'Club' feel with dark wood booths, brocade draperies, and elegant lighting! We will definitely return to this hidden gem the next time we are in Pittsburgh!

0NY3TrWh2YFEn_ivCU1Rqg.text: A hidden gem in Pittsburgh!  Fine dining is a clubby, quiet restaurant with a big wine selection and great food. It's a bit hard to find but in so glad we did find it!  My friend had the Delmonico Steak which was delicious. I had the Daily special which was Halibut in white wine sauce. Food and service were excellent!  Would definitely return.

rOXk5Z2XM0bF2A0JWDOkPg.text: I absolutely love The Carlton. We come here every year for my birthday and I'm never disappointed. They have a phenomenal wine selection, so many wonderful food options, and incredible deserts.   The Carlton provides an upscale dining experience at a reasonable price. It's the perfect place for any celebration and the qaulity cannot be beat.

ygLc-seikzRHFP0_fiAJkg.text: My husband and I tried out The Carlton for PGH Restaurant Week, and we had a great experience! The restaurant itself is located in the BNY Mellon building. It has its own parking garage, and parking is comped for restaurant guests! Score! We chose The Carlton for restaurant week specially because the $35 menu was surf AND turf! We both had the tomato crab bisque as our first choice and it was to die for!! As someone who loves tomato bisque and crab bisque, it was truly the best combo! For the surf options, my husband had the tomato pesto salmon and I had the grouper with lobster remoulade. The salmon was absolutely delicious, but the grouper was an absolute let down! The "lobster remoulade" was really one small bite of lobster in what tasted like sour cream. And my fish was SO small. Honestly 3 bites max.  However, we both got the prime rib and it was excellent. That was definitely the best part of the meal. When I made the reservation on Open Table, I made a note that our anniversary was coming up. I totally forgot that I did that, but the waitress brought out a fully size cookie sundae with a candle and "happy anniversary" written on. She also boxed up our desserts from the pre fixed menu to go. I thought that was a really nice gesture. The service was fantastic. Our water glasses were never empty (always a huge bonus) and the staff were all incredibly nice.  I gave 4 stars for 2 main reasons: the food was great, but the portions were small. My fish was so tiny and it was served with about 3 bites of potatoes. Second, all the food was served room temp. The fact that my prime rib wasn't hot meant that it was cooking while sitting and I hate that!  All in all, I would return to The Carlton and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice evening out!

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cappuccino torte cake
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Anniversary cookie sundae :)
Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Prime rib! Amazing!

iq13lqxgXRlQRyuvob4Rng.text: Awesome halibut and Cabernet Sauvignon. Sinful cookie with ice cream dessert shared with friends. Everything was delicious - great place for an amazing dinner. This place surprisingly worked well for a large group... I could hear and have conversation with folks at the other end of my table and there were 12 of us.

photos.caption: Photo of The Carlton - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Halibut over brown rice - YUM!!

LdNu871YeCJtpRRpcrGqRA.text: Amazing food, fantastic service, and very reasonable prices.  Restaurant has been around for 35 years and I've never knew about this gem.  Can't wait to go wait as so many menu items looked delicious.  Portion sizes were great.  Can't speak highly enough about The Carlton.  Probably one of the best wine lists in the city with prices that can't be beat for a restaurant of this caliber.  Do yourself a favor and take date to this place especially if they are a seafood lover.  You and your date won't be disappointed.

eUUj0AqVNULTcYB9YliiqQ.text: Came for restaurant week. Our server James was amazing, very attentive for a busy Friday night, along with the rest of the staff. Parking was easy and validated as soon as we walked in the door.    The shrimp In the shrimp diablo were huge and it had a great sweet/spicy mango salsa. I had the Crab stuffed grouper for the main course, I'm super picky on seafood so I was a little skeptical, but it did not disappoint. Best grouper I've ever had. The dessert was a little rich but paired with an espresso was perfect.  I will definitely be going back very soon !

EmLas1Qj-SFUi5SkgIwHNQ.text: The crab cakes are so delicious!  Portions are quite generous.  Will be dining again here during my stay!!

05Iznhh-14n6pCf8G_Q_SQ.text: This is old Pittsburgh type food, unless you work in the building and it is raining I would avoid.  Not sure who even goes here but I would equate it to a bad version of McCormick's. Below expectations.

3X_pljUhhJ8_n-m4idcDvg.text: My wife and I dined at the Carlton the evening before Valentine's Day during a getaway weekend in Pittsburgh. It was fair but certainly nothing to write home about, in our opinion. The pricing and overall Yelp rating had our hopes higher, so we were moderately disappointed. I enjoyed the throwback feel of the place, and we did not tap into the extensive wine selection they offered. While our experience was decent, I will look for other options whenever we return to town.

ato-o2hebQ9FsghzX-fXrQ.text: Awesome bartender and cool local vibe at the bar.  I hear the restaurant has a large wine selection as well!

Z1LF7OYB7cdGNiiem7jC0w.text: This is a typical, traditional upscale restaurant in the downtown of a medium sized American city.   If you're looking for trendy or hip, this is not the place.  But if you're looking for helpful & friendly service, an extensive & fairly priced wine list, and classic food, then this is a good place.  It won't be the most memorable meal of your life, but I don't think you'll regret it either.  Their menu changes a little each day.  My favorite is the NY Strip with the Jack Daniels glaze and blue cheese crumbles.  Don't be confused this isn't the TGI Fridays Jack Daniels glaze.  It's always available, even if you can't find it on the menu, just ask.  Other popular items are the sole and Beef Wellington.  This is also a great place to eat before a Penguins game.  Though it's a place that would usually draw a dressy crowd, they don't mind the Penguins jerseys on game nights.  They'll get you in and out before the drop of the puck and you won't feel rushed.  They also will validate your parking at the garage in the basement of the building, so hand your ticket to the hostess.

FVFHgWXuofIgrKoeciZVPA.text: The Carlton is a go-to place in downtown Pittsburgh where you are assured to have solid service, a great meal and a strong drink at their bar. Although you are not going to find a lot of trendy items in the entree selection, the lack of such items keeps the Carlton True to form as a classic American upscale restaurant. I have eaten dinner and lunch about 45 times at the Carlton and never had a bad meal or poor service. The wine list is quite deep and the selections are excellent. (You can find some deals on the wine list with modest markup despite the PA state store monopoly) For regulars, this is the kind of place that will remember your name, what you drink and who your friends are and how they've been. You don't get that at even more expensive places or private clubs anymore. Get the filet mignon rare with asparagus and the garlic mash and ask for the bernaise sauce on the side. (You have to ask for the fillet it is not in the big list of entrees) Let the server pick you a full bodied red by the glass to go with it and you will be on a whole new level of epic. Finish the meal off with their signature whisky bread pudding paired with a single malt scotch or decent port and you will never feel better legally.

3U-cpFJXqotndng0o1Nknw.text: Yawn.... oh, excuse me! I just woke from my nap... err... dinner, I mean, at um, what is this place? Oh yeah, The Carlton.  Let's set the stage: dark wood, white table cloths, waiters dressed like busboys, busboys dressed like...something dull, fat men in suits that makes lots of money smoking cigars in the bar laughing about dull things, a menu that is well, dull. Getting the picture?  Pretty much this is a place for the good ol' boys. Not the NASCAR, Skoal chewing, shotgun shooting, good ol' boys, but the ~rich~ good ol' boys. You know, vote Republican all the time, play golf even though they suck at it, drive enormous cars, and live in houses bigger than the city block you live on.  Okay, okay, so the food isn't bad per se. In fact it was quite tasty if you like a lot of butter and oil...over everything. This place ain't going to win any culinary awards but if you're looking to entertain the above mentioned crowd, you simply won't go wrong here. Otherwise, save your money ('cause it definitely ain't cheap here) and hit up one of the many much cooler places in town.

579lsDXg5wwmZZUrY-N5LA.text: Recently ate at the Carlton in BNY Mellon for my buddies birthday.  I was one in a group of 12.  One positive thing I can say is the waiter was thorough and very helpful with suggestions, etc.  I started off with gnocchi appetizer which was his suggestion, not bad.  I would rate it a B average.  I was torn between the prime rib and the lamb chops, he suggested the prime rib.  I got the prime rib cooked to the chef's suggestion, came out about med-rare but WAS NOT HOT.  To say it was warm might have been pushing it.  Lack of flavor with the beef is an understatement.  I wasn't impressed at all. The mashed potatoes weren't hot either.  I was pretty disappointed to say the least.    A few friends recommended the prime rib and when I told them about my experience they were shocked.  I wouldn't waste the money to go back thats for sure!.  If another birthday or event got scheduled there I would most likely attend but it's not a place I would suggest.    For the price the food wasn't impressive AT ALL.  The best part of the evening was the 8.00 coffee i had at the end of the night.  The other plus about this place is if you park in the BNY Mellon garage they validate your parking ticket at the hostess stand.

s0SMljuQdzjLptxEwyT11A.text: Elegant Downtown eating establishment, great for pre-theater as they have a shuttle that takes patrons to their venue after their meal. The food is quite good and is not too expensive for a classy night out.

H76eXYY4TjkAeaSSbBTafQ.text: Never have a bad meal.  Everything is always good.  Can't go wrong with this downtown restaurant.  Older crowd, much older.

XCV1hruTDSeWGyccdTr52g.text: My husband and I frequently go here for very special occasions.  The food is excellent and the service is outstanding from Janet at the front desk to the waiter, Michael.  Last evening we and friends celebrated our anniversaries.  If you want to have a memorable evening, go to the Carleton.

wlwIQxdfLCMGD3pMWovKlA.text: Reservation made on the recommendation of the concierge for New Years eve. Sat us 45 minutes late with no apology made. Staff was excellent but the menu was limited in scope with regards to both seafood and steak. Two basic choices for fish and two for meat with none of the traditional steak cuts. Was hoping for a better dining experience as this is touted as a local landmark but was disappointed. Can't say I would go out of my way when next in town.

V5maHGlcjsk-ApzxmhaSww.text: My husband made a reservation for a belated valentines day celebration. We had been to the Carlton 3 other times for special occasions and had wonderful experiences. Tonight was a bit of a different experience. I think the waitress may have exchanged 25 words with us in 1.5 hours. The service was fine but I felt like I was at Olive Garden. I am normally a 20% or more tipper no matter what. But I showed her... 15% is all she got! She did not even deserve that!

vqq11njnyHlcnSJdqFporA.text: I feel a bit bad about this 2 stars. But really unless you like conservative, bland to my taste, 80s style, steak house food. Maybe the steak is good but we didn't try it. Recommended for Grandparents with conservative palates and sentiment for the 80s.  Service - the bright note here, very nice.  Atmosphere - think 80s clubby steakhouse style. The bathrooms were stinky and not updated.  Food - we ordered 3 appetizers and a salad:  Okay iceberg with blue cheese dressing salad;  very bland dry crostini with "roasted vegetables" with almost no taste, maybe no salt, possibly no oil and dry - yes dry - mesclun mix like you might buy at Costco;  bbq shrimp had a slightly red sauce that had a gravy taste (some kind of stock?) and virtually no flavor and 5 shrimp - not even jumbo - with more dry mesclun for I think $11;  a good value gnocchi with plenty of chunks not shards of lobster and crab - would have been very very good if served on the sauce instead of drenched in the creamy rich cheesy sauce and with a dose of some flavor - still good. Bread from Breadworks - good of course.  Price - 3 appetizers, 1 salad, 1 glass of wine, 1 soda plus tax and tip = $75.

n6a3_NLKJy4c_6LCbIm7cQ.text: Excellent food served excellently. The decor is definitely old-school steakhouse, but that doesn't matter when you have one of the dishes placed before you. The crabcake appetizer is creamy and nicely sauced, the gnocchi and lobster appetizer is heaven. I've had nearly all of the entrees there over the years, and I've never been disappointed. The consistency in the food is also admirable.  The Carlton is known for its great wines (and the servers are well-versed in them). All in all, it's a very nice special-occasion restaurant.

oMM45j1UQ-AmBqMjjNtjAA.text: We went early (about 5:00) on a Saturday. The food was reasonable, although the quality was a bit poor given the price. For example, the scallops were nickel-sized on a $30 entre. The main issue was that after we paid, but still had desert and drinks in front of us, the waiter began not-so-subtly urging us to leave. We were still finishing our drinks the second time he bugged us to move on, and that isn't really appreciated, no matter how much you're paying for a meal. We won't go back.

Gixx_Iy3DQSSX1EwCa6SRA.text: The Carlton is a staple in the city of Pittsburgh.  The restaurant is in located in one BNY Mellon Center.  Nationally recognized, the Carlton is the only eatery and recipient of the Distinguished Restaurant of North America Award.  Kevin Joyce, the owner and proprietor, is quite proud of this fact.  If you choose to dine at the Carlton, you will see Mr. Joyce on a regular basis; he likes to be in the thick of things.  Kevin also is actively involved in local politics- it's been rumored that he will one day run for Mayor.  The Carlton has an extensive wine list, with over 550 selections; the wine is very reasonably priced, significantly below that of his competitors.  If you're looking for a great place to relax and unwind after work, you can't go wrong at the bar. The walls are decorated with caricatures of regulars and other famous people that have eaten at the restaurant.  The bar is stocked with top shelf liquor; aged scotch, bourbon, and of course, wine any of the more 550 wine selections!  If you need to vent, the bartenders are always friendly, and happy to lend an ear.  The food at the Carlton is top shelf as well.  You can get almost anything you want from Chilean Sea Bass, to a piece of Rib Roast- which I highly recommend.  We opted for the Calamari for a starter.  It was crisp and fresh, nicely seasoned and served with a tomato-basil sauce; excellent.  The crab cakes were also good, with julienne vegetables and a Dijon-cream sauce.  The dinner salad was comprised of field greens, tomatoes with lemon-honey vinaigrette.  For my entree, I chose the grilled Atlantic salmon.  The salmon was seasoned, and cooked to a perfect medium, also very good.  My guests had the Rack of Lamb ($33.95) and the Herb Grilled Chicken ($27.95).  The lamb was tender and juicy, and the chicken was quite good too, with hints of rosemary, garlic and spicy olive oil.  Our waiter was attentive, but didn't bother us too much- a good combination.  Other entrees on the menu include: Ahi Tuna ($27.95), Grouper ($30.95), and Sea Scallops ($32.95).  If there's something you want that's not on the menu, just ask, and Chef Mark Swomley will prepare it for you.  The menus are seasonal, so you can always count on a wide variety of selections during the year.  In addition to the regular menu, The Carlton also offers wine dinners.  The special meals include several courses of meticulously prepared food with some of the finest wines of the region; a rare and special treat.       My favorite part of eating at the Carlton- the desserts; they're all made in-house by the pastry chef.  Try the creme brulee, or the chocolate cake.  There are many different kinds of deliciousness too choose from, just make sure to try something!  If you're looking for the best birthday cakes in the city, order one from Eadie's on the first floor, also owned by Mr. Joyce.  If you haven't sampled the food at the Carlton, make a reservation soon. The Carlton Restaurant 500 Grant Street Pittsburgh, PA 15219-2502 (412) 391-4099

RfoWLR3upagFYvzIU7p-nQ.text: This place is rather snooty... or at least trying to be. The decor is "chamberish" with dark wood and leather. Servers are dressed better than some of the patrons. Food is memorable, especialy their fish. This place is a bit on the expensive side, but I think the price is right for the quality.

_YsBZUE48usTRsiapcgX1Q.text: This is a good place to take your parents or to have a business event.  The location is right in the city (mellon center).  The bar is relatively small with most seating in old leather chairs and some table tops.  The decor is definitely old school with the wallpaper being golfers in traditional garb in a picturesque (sp?), 1920's scene with girls golfing in dresses.  The rest of the restaurant is dark wood, leather, and white tops.  The servers are dressed in tuxes or suits and in my experience are True professionals.  I have a couple business dinner parties here a year and have always been extremely pleased.  I've never come here on a date and I suggest if you are under 50 there are much better date spots to take your partner.  However, for all its old school charm the menu can be occassionally surprisingly nuanced and fresh.  My favorite is to have the wine dinners here.  The chef truly is talented and always comes up with something surprising and delicious.  Also, props need to be paid to Kevin Joyce for fighting this damn county drink tax.  He also serves some of the best, reasonably priced wine in the city and has been for decades.  I didn't do the wine tasting dinner last night, but instead went a more traditional route offering multiple entree choices.  The dinner starts with either a carlton salad or soup of the day.  The carlton salad looked awesome, romaine, tomatoes, mushrooms, bacon, hard boiled egg and creamy dressing (definitely not for the dieter).  The soup I had last night was the three food groups, those being cheese, bacon, and potatoes.  The soup was obviously heavy, but I found way too salty and in general not a good choice for me.  It sat in my stomach like a sock full of nickels.  Many ordered the seafood wellington, which I've had before and it's another non-dieter dish comprising of pastry, sole, lobster, crab and cheese.  This dish is definitely rich and tasty.  I tried the prime rib, which was about an average tasting non- "prime" prime rib with plenty of marbeling and cooked well enough.  However, I've had just as good prime rib if not better at Outback.  The most delicious presentation goes to the veal portabello which is sauteed veal with capers adn mushrooms, whipped potatoes and a nice tomato beurre blanc.  Sadly, I didn't get a chance to try this.  I was told it was delicious.  The desserts were all good and most likely prepared in house.  I tried the award winning chocolate cheesecake which was very good.  I only wish they had some lighter dessert options like berries.  All in all a great restaurant for the older crowd or business events.  The servers, especially Faye are awesome.  Last night Faye literally chased me down the parking garage to give me my leftovers.  The food deserves 3 stars, the servers 4 stars, and the wine prices and Kevins anti tax efforts 5 stars.  This is a True Pittsburgh institution.
